subsection.name: Overview
subsection.p: In the CMS, in the document section there should be an extra harmonica called 'URL Rewriter'. When you click one of folders you will see an overview of the rules with some extra information like the from, to and type of redirect. Note that this does not display the conditions, or even if there are any. The rules will be processed in the order they appear, so keep this in mind when creating rules of different depth. For example, the rule rewriting /abc should come after the rule rewriting /abc/def.
Which rules and conditions have been configured and in what order they will be processed can be seen on the status page. By default /rewrite-status, but only accessible locally.

subsection.name: Global Configuration
subsection.p: On the rulesLocation node (default: /content/urlrewriter) you can set some properties which will affect all rules.

tr.td: setting this to false will require you to prefix all the URLs you want to match with the contextpath, use this if you don't strip the context path from your URLs
when set to true, the query string is taken into account when matching URLs
(since 1.04.01) this is a multiple string, each value is a prefix that should not be rewritten
(since 1.04.01) when set to true, POST requests will not be rewritten
